name: East Bay Pie
specialties: Specialties: East Bay Pie Co. from Our Kitchen To Yours we offer frozen pies shipped to your door, providing a quick and delicious meal option. Established in 2020.  East Bay Pie Co was born from the minds of two long time Bay Area culinary industry colleagues. Rahul, one of the cofounders, was inspired by the Bay Area food scene, while Bill, the other cofounder, having grown up eating fresh produce right out of his grandma's garden, realized the importance of using local purveyors. Using their knowledge in the culinary world, they wanted to introduce a concept that provided customers with an array of flavors from all around the world. Made right out of their Emeryville kitchen, they utilize local vendors and top quality ingredients for their savory and sweet hand pies. They hope to let their customers experience the essence of different cultures through their simple, yet untraditional hand pies.

Acting with care ensures that efficiency never becomes haste and quality never suffers for convenience. name: Angeline's Louisiana Kitchen
specialties: Specialties: Angeline's brings the flavor and atmosphere of a New Orleans neighborhood restaurant to downtown Berkeley, with great music, libations and the classic dishes invented in the Crescent City's greatest kitchens. We offer down-home classics like Gumbo, Jambalaya, Fried Catfish, or our Buttermilk Fried Chicken. For dessert, try our Bananas Foster Bread Pudding or our signature warm Beignets with chicory coffee. Whatever you try, you'll leave happy. Established in 2006.  Angeline's began as the dream of founder Robert Volberg as a way to bring southern hospitality and the delicious flavors of New Orleans to the bay area.  Inspired by the neighborhood jambalaya joints he had visited on a trip to the Big Easy six months before Katrina, Robert was looking for a location for his new restaurant when he struck up a conversation with a man in chef's pants in Oakland's Rockridge district.  The man was Chef Brandon Dubea from Baton Rouge, LA.  After working to develop an outstanding menu and create a delightful atmosphere, Angeline's opened quietly and gained popularity slowly after opening.  After reviews in the East Bay Express, SF Chronicle, Diablo Magazine and many others which hailed Chef Dubea's cuisine as 'authentic' and dishes as having 'real character', Angeline's was featured on an episode of 'Check Please, Bay Area'.  As word spread about the restaurant, Tempe Minaga completed the team as co-owner in mid 2008 to improve service and operations.

name: La Marcha Tapas Bar
specialties: Specialties: With its rustic outdoor patio, pops of bright color and welcoming atmosphere, La Marcha is a restaurant in the heart of Berkeley that encapsulates the vibrant culinary culture of Spain. Visitors will feel as though they have strolled right off the streets of Spain and into an authentic neighborhood tapas bar.Some Bay Area diners may recognize the duo behind this new venture. Chef-owners Sergio Emilio Monleon and Emily Sarlatte have gained quite a cult following for their incredible paellas, cooked at many events with their catering company Ñora Cocina Espanola. At La Marcha, the pair will continue to share their innovative take on Spanish cuisine in a space that offers a warm, lively local neighborhood vibe.Spanish cuisine is more than flavorful, it is brimming with energy and passion. La Marcha's menu of tapas and paellas, coupled with a community atmosphere, reflect the chefs' shared passion for Spanish cuisine, and their desire to transport the lively tapas bar culture they both experienced in Spain here to Berkeley. Fusing the best of Spanish culinary traditions with the bounty of fresh produce and ingredients the Bay Area has to offer has resulted in innovative dishes, such as their renowned Paella Tres Cerditos--saffron and rice flavored with chorizo, smoked pork belly, pork loin, lima beans, leeks and apple cider. Established in 2015.  Some Bay Area diners may recognize the duo behind this new venture.Chef / owners Sergio Emilio Monleon and Emily Sarlatte have gained quite a following for their incredible paellas, cooked at many high-end weddings and local food festivals with their catering company Ñora Cocina Espanola. At La Marcha, the pair will continue to share their innovative take on Spanish cuisine in a space that offers a warm, lively local neighborhood vibe.

name: Via del Corso
specialties: Specialties: A Destination... is really just a place you are going along your way. When you enter Via del Corso, you may feel as if you are in any trattoria in Florence, Rome, or any other place in Italy. In the heart of North Berkeley, we bring you a place to relax, restore, dine and have drinks with family and friends. Leave the outside world outside for a moment. It is our pleasure to welcome you to Via del Corso. Established in 2008.  What would a Florentine Trattoria be like if dropped in the middle of Berkeley?  Chef/Owner Wendy Brucker spent her summers in Florence, her father a preeminent Florentine scholar.   Florentine cuisine flavors her love of food.  Chef Louis Legassic holds a mirror to the bold simplicity of the first little big city.  Local produce and meats transformed by Old World, time honored recipes and techniques: a neighborhood trattoria between Downtown Berkeley and the Gourmet Ghetto.  Dinner nightly.

name: Sliver Pizzeria
specialties: Specialties: It is Sliver's mission to use fresh ingredients of the finest quality as a means to empower the fight against global human trafficking.One type of pizza is served in our restaurant each day, and we post pictures and ingredients daily on our website and social media platforms. We do this so our pizza ingredients are ultra fresh, as well as keeping your time in line at an absolute minimum. We celebrate the diverse community of downtown Berkeley by supporting local musicians. Come enjoy a great selection of jazz, blues, hip hop, reggae, and more Friday and Saturday night at no cover charge!Sliver has sincere compassion for human trafficking victims and zero tolerance for traffickers. We stay updated on the fight against modern day slavery and promote all efficient forms of abolitionism. Financially, we support organizations that are on the ground rescuing and rehabilitating victims, as well as those involved in preventative work. We are involved in community discussions on how to end slavery in this lifetime. Keep an eye out on our social media streams for who we are donating each month.Like us to be involved in discussions about pizza, recipes, fresh ingredients, and how YOU can help in the global fight against human trafficking. Established in 2013.  SLIVER opened in 2013. We hope that you will not only enjoy SLIVER as a restaurant, but consider yourself as one sliver in our mission to contribute to a bigger pie and make it whole.

name: Zachary's Chicago Pizza
specialties: Specialties: Zachary's Chicago Pizza is 100% employee-owned with five locations in the San Francisco Bay Area: Oakland- Rockridge, Oakland- Grand Lake, North Berkeley, Pleasant Hill and Pleasanton. Recognized locally and nationally with over 225 Best Pizza Awards, Zachary's offers 2 styles of pizza: a Chicago-style stuffed pizza and a traditional thin crust pizza. Online ordering is available! Established in 1983.  Founders Zach Zachowski & Barbara Gabel grew up in small towns in Wisconsin. After living in Chicago for several years, they developed a taste for Chicago-style pizza. In 1983, they found themselves in the East Bay with dreams of opening their own pizza restaurant - with a California twist. Zach & Barbara opened the original Zachary's on July 25, 1983 in the Rockridge neighborhood in Oakland. Business took off immediately. To meet the growing demand, they opened a second store in nearby Berkeley on Solano Avenue just over a year later in 1984. Two decades later, Zach & Barbara began handing over the company to the employees. In 2006 Zachary's in San Ramon opened. Four years later in 2010 we became 100% employee-owned! In 2013 we opened Zachary's in Downtown Pleasant Hill. We celebrated 36 years in the Bay Area in 2019 by opening our second Oakland location in the Grand Lake neighborhood. Our most recent adventure was the relocation of Zachary's San Ramon to Pleasanton in July of 2021!

name: Pizza Hut
address: 14501 San Pablo Ave San Pablo, CA 94806
specialties: Specialties: Find your nearby Pizza Hut at 14501 San Pablo Ave in San Pablo, CA. You can try, but you can't OutPizza the Hut. We're serving up classics like Meat Lovers and Original Stuffed Crust as well as signature wings, pastas and desserts at many of our locations. Order online or on the mobile app for carryout, curbside or delivery. Established in 1958.  In 1958, two brothers borrowed $600 from their mom to open a pizza place in Wichita, Kansas. They named it Pizza Hut because their sign only had room for eight letters. How profound! Soon, the restaurant grew. Why? The pizza was awesome. The service felt like home. And the customers were treated like family. And we've been delivering that same food and service ever since. For the Love of Pizza Since 1958. From day one, the Carney brothers could look their customers in the eye and promise them the finest pizza in town -- because they knew the farmers who grew the ingredients, and they knew those farmers cared about quality. Since then, our farmers have grown right alongside us, and the ingredients we use are still our highest priority. No one loves pizza more than Pizza Hut. That's why pizza is in our name -- and always will be.

specialties: Specialties: A contemporary, farm-to-table French restaurant influenced by California culinary cuisine. Inspiration at Julia's begins with the bounty of local and organic products available in the Bay Area and highlighted with French techniques. Combined with a beautiful atmosphere and friendly service, Julia's creates a memorable dining experience for all guests. Established in 2012.  Julia's Restaurant is located on the second floor of the historic Berkeley City Club. The building was originally opened in 1930 as a women's social club with private residences and dining room. The Club was eventually opened to both men and women in 1965 and changed its name from Berkeley Women's City Club to Berkeley City Club. Still remaining primarily a private social club for quite some time, the restaurant was finally opened to the public in 2012.

name: Asha Tea House
specialties: Specialties: There is a cup of tea out there for everyone, whether it's a simple glass of straight tea, or a crafted cup of flavored tea. At Asha, we strive to feed your love for tea by serving high-quality whole leaf tea and hand-crafted tea drinks made with fresh, pure and real ingredients. We travel extensively to source teas directly from growers and make almost everything from scratch so that we know exactly what we're serving. We also purposely limit our drink and tea selections to showcase a small but comprehensive representation of what the tea world has to offer, and we make a big effort to share everything we're learning as we help build America's tea culture.    But we also know that drinking tea isn't just about the drink. It's also about where you drink it and who you drink it with--which is why we designed every element of our tea house to maximize your tea-drinking enjoyment. Established in 2012.  Responsibly-sourced artisan whole-leaf tea & globally-inspired hand-crafted tea beverages from house-made ingredients."Asha" is Taiwanese for "someone that enjoys life", and our hope is that drinking Asha tea will remind you of the things you enjoy about life.

Established in 2004.  Gioia Pizzeria was founded in May of 2004 by Will and Karen Gioia. Located on Hopkins Street in North Berkeley, Gioia is nestled in a food-lover's paradise frequented by neighborhood residents partaking of the delights of the street. For Karen and Will being part of the community is essential. They feel that a connection with a community is ideal for their business, which they envision as a family run joint selling the thin crust, east-coast style pizza of Will's childhood, with a focus on the organic, sustainably raised local ingredients so ready available in California.A defining childhood moment of Will's is going down the street for a slice and a Coke. Will wanted to bring that tradition to the kids of his Berkeley neighborhood, as well as working families and anyone who can appreciate grabbing a slice or a pie on the run, or sitting on one of the stools in the store watching the pizza makers spin dough and their neighbors coming and going.

name: Saul's Restaurant & Delicatessen
specialties: Specialties: Since 1986, Saul's Delicatessen and Bakery has celebrated the vibrant, authentic Jewish deli traditions by creating a space that honors the old world and the new. Current owners Sam Tobis and Jose Mendoza rather than replicating the delis of New York, are creating a space that connects with roots all along the timeline of the Jewish diaspora. A space that draws from the old Ashkenazi European Jewish tradition, the Mizrahi Israeli tradition, and the new world of New York, Los Angeles, and Berkeley. For us, that meant starting with locally sourced, humane, and sustainable ingredients, house-made pastrami and corned beef, hand-rolled and chewy bagels boil/baked daily. So gather around a table in our large dining room, reminisce over old favorites and discover new ones. Established in 1986.  In the 1930's the Saul's building was a produce depot right off the railroad tracks. Since the 1950's, it has housed a delicatessen: First the Pantry Shelf, then Rosenthal's, and finally Saul's, established in 1986, in honor of Saul Lichtenstein. Saul and his wife Ginny liked to feed people. Saul held forth and Ginny cooked. Friends and family would gather with him to eat, talk with their mouths full, trade stories. We like all that. So come. Eat. Locally owned and operated.Find answers to these FAQ's on our website!- Are your meats hormone and antibiotic free? Are the animals treated humanely?- Why is this night different from all others?- Why does the pastrami and corned beef seem more expensive than at other deli counters?- What size should a deli sandwich be?- Are the meats Kosher?- Is Saul's Kosher?- Why isn't there a good New York deli here?

name: Zachary's Chicago Pizza
specialties: Specialties: Zachary's Chicago Pizza is 100% employee-owned with five locations in the San Francisco Bay Area: Oakland-Rockridge, Oakland-Grand Lake, North Berkeley, Pleasant Hill and Pleasanton. Recognized locally and nationally with over 225 Best Pizza Awards, Zachary's offers 2 styles of pizza: a Chicago-style stuffed pizza and a traditional thin crust pizza. Online ordering is available! Established in 1983.  Founders Zach Zachowski & Barbara Gabel grew up in small towns in Wisconsin. After living in Chicago for several years, they developed a taste for Chicago-style pizza. In 1983, they found themselves in the East Bay with dreams of opening their own pizza restaurant - with a California twist. Zach & Barbara opened the original Zachary's on July 25, 1983 in the Rockridge neighborhood in Oakland. Business took off immediately. To meet the growing demand, they opened a second store in nearby Berkeley on Solano Avenue just over a year later in 1984. Two decades later, Zach & Barbara began handing over the company to the employees. In 2006 Zachary's in San Ramon opened. Four years later in 2010 we became 100% employee-owned! In 2013 we opened Zachary's in Downtown Pleasant Hill. We celebrated 36 years in the Bay Area in 2019 by opening our second Oakland location in the Grand Lake neighborhood. Our most recent adventure was the relocation of Zachary's San Ramon to Pleasanton in July of 2021!

Whether you're meeting a friend for a drink, cozying up solo to the bar, writing the next great American novel, or on a date, North Light is for you.A plant-filled back patio with retractable roof, breezy parklet, and intimate book and record shop curated by some of the best living writers, musicians, and artists make us unique. Our food is delicious and fresh; our drinks are ambitious but approachable; and our staff treat everybody with warmth and care. Established in 2019.  North Light is the lovechild of a rock and roll promoter and a published novelist. A little cocktail bar with a stunning back patio and heated parklet, it pairs fresh and shameless drinking food with award-winning, imaginative cocktails.

name: Tender Greens
specialties: Specialties: We start with the best ingredients, cook from the heart and let our food do the talking. No compromises, no matter what. Sustainability is at the core of all the choices we make, from our food to our planet to the future of farming. It's in our DNA. After all, we're chefs. Established in 2006.  Two chefs and a foodie set out to change the way people eat for the better. Our inspiration? The meals we had when our friends came over. The food. The pairings. The exploration. The energy. And the promise that on any given day we'd eat or drink something we wouldn't find anywhere else. So we opened Tender Greens in 2006 and started a food revolution. Welcome to our kitchen.

name: Triple Rock Brewery & Ale House
specialties: Specialties: From its opening in 1986, Triple Rock has specialized in brewing and serving craft beer in a relaxed, classic tavern atmosphere. On any given day, choose from a selection of 10+ handcrafted beers brewed on site. Some favorites include the IPAX West Coast style IPA, Red Rock American Red Ale, Black Rock Porter, Stonehenge Stout, Titanium American Strong Ale, Pinnacle English Style Pale Ale, and Dragon's Milk American Brown Ale, but make sure to check out the rotating selection of small batch specialty brews. Established in 1985.  Brothers John and Reid Martin (then ages 25 and 28), established Triple Rock in 1985. Triple Rock is the result of John and Reid's love for beer and brewing, as well as the love of classic American taverns (and dive bars). For Triple Rock, their idea was to create a place that would be simple and accessible to craft beer and classic tavern aficionados like themselves.More than 25 years after brewing their first brew, John and Reid Martin are considered "founding fathers" in the brewpub industry, and have gone on to build a small empire of award-winning breweries and bars (Big Time Brewery in Seattle, Drakes Brewing Co. in San Leandro, and Jupiter in Berkeley). Still, Triple Rock remains their favorite. "It's where real brewpub beer began in the Bay Area," says John. "We feel lucky to have been there at the beginning of the craft brewing renaissance". Some say that you can see a little of Triple Rock in almost every brewpub.

name: Mount Everest
specialties: Specialties: Located in the heart of Berkeley,  we offer authentic, organic, delicious Indian and Napalese cuisine. Come in and see for yourself!Nepalese foods: Daal Bhat Tarkari, MoMo, Chowmein, Sekuwa, Choila,   Khasi Ko Masu(goat  masu)Indian food: Chicken Tikka Masala, Palak Paneer, Baingan Bartha, Navratna Korma,Chicken Vindaloo, Lamb Curry, Fish Tandoori, Prawn Curry, and alot.We also deliver! Established in 2010.  Mount Everest Restaurant is located at the place where there used to be Tandoor Kitchen. We have changed the name but we are still serving the same food with better quality and quantity. The ownership has been changed to the former CHEF of Tandoor Kitchen therefore the quality has been improved and maintained too. Previously it was a fast food type of restaurant but now focused in service.

name: Razan's Organic Kitchen
specialties: Specialties: Razan's Organic Kitchen features organic green salads,freshly squeezed juices, and all kind of fruits and vegetables smoothies Burritos, International Wraps, and Combo Plates, using all organic ingredients and free-range chicken,grass fed  beef and wild fish, and is located in downtown Berkeley, on Kittredge between Shattuck and Fulton, near UC Berkeley campus's and  next to the historic California theater. Established in 1993.  In 1993 we started our first food cart at UC berkeley on Sproul Hall on Bancroft and Teleghraph St at the south side of UC campus, in 1997, we opened our permanent spot at 2119 kittredge st in Berkeley Ca. It is family owned and one of the first restaurant that promoted organic healthy food.our food is free of toxic pesticides,herbicide and industrial fertilizers, and all of our food can be prepared free of gluten if costomers chose to do so.We use CCOF and USDA certified organic vegetables, grass fed beef, organic chicken and fresh wild sockey, and coho salmon free of dye and antibiotics.

name: Townhouse
specialties: Specialties: Welcome to Townhouse - an Emeryville staple since the days of Prohibition. Now serving tavern style Californian, with a Mediterranean twist. The newest iteration of Townhouse is still the place to come if you want to enjoy an amazing patio, fantastic service and food to fill your soul. Serving dinner, Tuesday to Saturday from 4p to 9p. Established in 1990.  Built by a local fireman in 1926 and immediately rented by a bootlegger named Blackie, Townhouse went from Speakeasy to brothel, to bar, to family restaurant known as Vernetti's Towhouse and back to bar again until its current incarnation, Townhouse Bar & Grill. Opened by Ellen Hope and French restaurateur Joseph LeBrun in 1990, Townhouse served up simple dishes in a rustic yet elegant space. Townhouse Bar & Grill had been Chef Ellen's pride and joy since 2002 when she became the soul owner and operator. With 2020 came a global pandemic and the end of an era - Townhouse had to close its doors and Ellen has passed the torch onto a trusted and experienced team. Keeping in the tradition of comfort classics with an elevated  style, our new kitchen crew has created a menu that's fresh, local and serves as an ode to our cherished and storied history. Come and enjoy what the new team has cultivated at the old Townhouse.

name: 310 Eatery
specialties: Specialties: Typically deemed by our fans to offer the very best burgers in the East Bay including our blended beef and bacon 405 Traffic Jam Burger, The 310 is also well known for creating unique dishes that define what most call, "Food Coma." Some of our featured dishes include The Tokyo Po' Boy Soft Shell Crab Sandwich, home made pork bellies and fried chicken all of which comes together to make every one on the table content with whatever they are craving for. Additionally, we are serve up our "Krazy Delish" Breakfast/Brunch on weekends starting at 10:00 AM, Sat/Sundays and major holidays.  Finally, we look forward to adding Asian Inspired Noodles and Japanese Style, Jiggly Souffle's Pancakes to our recurring Menus. Established in 2014.  Serving "Krazy-Delish" cuisine since 2014 in Downtown Walnut Creek, The 310 has since Detoured to other memorable destinations to include Alameda, Oakland (popping up at The Mad Oak Bar) Downtown Berkeley and flash forward to the present, to our most recent home in Albany, CA (Est. 2018). Through it all and "Since Day One," The 310 is proud to say it has maintained a very well received and continuous 4.5 Stars Yelp rating - Flash forward to 2020, The 310 is now listed by Yelp as One of The Top 100 Places To Eat in The US! A huge THANK YOU to all those who have supported us through the years and those that continue to support our forward moving journey through today.

name: Uji Time Dessert
specialties: Specialties: Japanese fusion style dessert - Soft serve and parfaits including Matcha, sesame, tofu and other favors.- mochi ice cream with seasonal flavors.- Uji Time Ice Cream Established in 2016.  Uji Time Dessert opened its first pop up store in April 2016 and is known for its Taiyaki soft serve. The pop up was a great success because of its authenticity. Uji Time Dessert was the first dessert store selling taiyaki soft serve in the Bay Area. Uji Time Dessert loves to combine and meld elements from multiple traditional desserts to create affordable treats for everyone. Our goal is simple - Think of Uji Time Dessert when you crave Japanese fusion style desserts. Uji Time Dessert regularly offers instagrammable, fun and delicious desserts and ice cream for all ages.Uji Time Dessert has transformed itself into a full scale dessert cafe, from Fish Cone (taiyaki), black sesame soft serve, lychee ice cream mochi, Matcha Latte, Earl Grey puddings, to Hojicha and Genmaicha ice cream. Depending on the season, Uji Time Dessert offers limited production seasonal flavors, such as strawberry rose and lavender in soft serve or ice cream.

name: Acme Bread Company
specialties: Specialties: Acme's goal remains the same today as in 1983 when the company was founded:we strive to make the best bread that we possibly can. Established in 1983.  Steven and Suzie Sullivan founded The Acme Bread Company in 1983 to bake bread for restaurants and stores who wanted to offer better bread than was generally available on the wholesale market at the time. Acme supplies bread to dozens of restaurants around the Bay Area including Chez Panisse, where Steven began baking bread in the seventies, as well as to scores of grocery stores and retail locations around the Bay Area.When the bakery started up in 1983 we made only four different kinds of Bread: Pain au Levain, Sweet Baguettes, Upstairs Bread, and Challah. Relying largely on the requests aRelying largely on the requests and suggestions of customers, as well on our own occasional inspiration, we have expanded our product list over the last twenty-some-odd years to include more than 100 different products.Since we began operation all our whole-grain flours have been organic but since the nineties, Acme has been incorporating as many organic and locally sourced ingredients

name: AKEMI Japanese Restaurant
specialties: Specialties: At AKEMI, we believe special occasions merit an exceptional celebration. That's why we've crafted a place where memories are made and excellence is served. Our menu focuses on what makes a meal truly great: the right ingredients and a chef's guiding vision. On our simple but exciting menu, traditional concepts meet fusion ideas using the best fish, the freshest local produce, and natural proteins, all for a uniquely flavorful experience. Pair with your favorite sake and enjoy your meal in our modern yet elegant dining room -- we know you'll savor every moment. Established in 2011.  We've been offering the Bay Area a place to celebrate everyday and special occasions alike since 2011. AKEMI is the latest incarnation of miyuki. Along with a revamped interior and exterior that includes salvaged wood and upgraded kitchen equipment, AKEMI features an updated menu spotlighting fresh ingredients and well-crafted flavors while retaining customer classics such as our sushi rolls.

name: Takara Sake USA
specialties: Specialties: We are open every day: Mon, Wed-Sun from 12:00 pm to 6:00 pm. (last sake tasting at 5:00 pm) Tue from 12:00pm to 5:00 pm. (last sake tasting at 4:00 pm).  You can choose from a few different flights ranging from $10 to $20.Reservations required for Saturday tastings.Takara Sake USA Inc., is a member of Takara Group, the leading corporation of alcohol-related business and biotechnology based in Japan. Takara has great experience in producing Shochu, Mirin, and Sake for more than one-and-a-half centuries. Because Takara's main business endeavors depend heavily on the mastery of natural processes such as fermentation, the Company feels a strong responsibility toward preserving the natural environment. As a self-proclaimed "Harmonist," Takara engages in activities aimed at educating people about the importance of sustainable coexistence with nature. Its work in this area is embodied in Takara's corporate philosophy: "Contributing to the creation of a vital society and a healthy lifestyle for its members through our fermentation technology and biotechnology in a way that achieves harmony with nature." Established in 1983.  Takara Sake USA was established in 1983 in Berkeley, California. The main products produced in Berkeley are the "Sho Chiku Bai" brand of sake, "Takara Mirin" and plum wine. Takara Sake USA has taken pure snow melt from the Sierra Nevada Mountains and superior rice from the fertile Sacramento Valley. To this, they apply traditional sake-making craftsmanship and modern technology to produce a Sake worthy of the Takara mark. Various products like premium sake and shochu are imported from our parent company in Japan. We also have a unique Tasting Room and Sake Museum. It is our hope to introduce the public not only to different types of sake but also to Japanese culture.

name: Ajanta
specialties: Specialties: Ajanta features an ever-changing menu, offering creative dishes from various regions of India. The elegant dining hall features Indian artwork inspired by the caves of Ajanta. Altogether, Ajanta is one of the best places to experience sophisticated Indian dining in the East Bay. Established in 1993.  Chef Lachu Moorjani immigrated to USA in to work as an engineer. He missed Indian food and checked out all the Indian restaurants in the Bay Area. His dining experience in these restaurants left him very dis-satisfied. Being a lover of good food, he decided to cook for himself in a serious way. Soon, his reputation as a cook spread and he was recruited by a couple of his friends to open an Indian restaurant in San Francisco in 1974. The partnership did not work. In 1987, he opened a small restaurant in Berkeley on his own called New Delhi Junction. At this restaurant Mr. Moorjani offered a menu with dishes from various regions of India. The small restaurant did very well. In 1993, Mr. Moorjani sold New Delhi Junction and opened Ajanta. He expanded the regional part of the menu, brought in organic ingredients, and introduced Chef's Tasting menu. As evidenced by numerous awards, Mr. Moorjani has succeeded  in his mission to provide in-comparable Indian dining experience to his patrons.

name: Way Station Brew
specialties: Specialties: Open 7 days a week!  WayStationBrewRestaurantCoffee BarBeer GardenDAYS: 8am-3pm Mon-Sat, 9am-3pm Sun. Kitchen closes at 2pm. NIGHTS: 6:30-9:30 Wed-Sat. -Our Wagyu Smash Burger Menu!  Kitchen closes at 9pm. A favorite Neighborhood Restaurant with fantastic Coffee & Beer. Your daily Cafe and Specialty Coffee Roaster who cares just as much about delicious, quality food. Plus a solid beer selection. Win Win Win!Way Station Brew is a hidden gem just off the beaten path of Downtown Berkeley -- Come fall in love. We are a coffee roaster's cafe and a restaurant with a sunny beer garden patio. Experience friendly neighborhood hospitality and a menu that is hearty and delicious. The cafe is warm and cozy and the beer garden is dog-friendly. For breakfast enjoy our legendary house-made scones, classic breakfasts and our customer-favorite fried egg sandwich.  For lunch our hot sandwiches and Wagyu Smash Burgers go down great with a cold beer... everything you need to unwind all day and everyday.WayStationBrew- Find us on Instagram- Delicious, fresh meals for Vegans to Carnivores - $5 Mimosas- Famous Hot Scones every morning- Fresh Roasted Coffee In-House- Full Espresso based menu- Kyoto Cold DripBreakfast, Lunch, and Burger Dinner Menu, legendary scones and Firebrand pastry all to wash down with our house-roasted coffee, a variety of mimosas, a large selection of beer and delicious natural wines too.  Established in 2017.  That's two years and a pandemic!  We thank you for your patience as we get back on our feet.  In 2017... A cook, a baker and a coffee roaster walk into a way station...  In 2020 everything went sideways but we've held on thanks to a great community of friends, neighbors, family, and our wonderful and hardworking team!  We're dedicated to building a better Way Station for all.  The setting is a charming brick building from the 1880's with a fantastic outdoor beer garden. A warm and inviting gem in a sea of cold, shiny and new.  Serving Breakfast, Lunch, and Wagyu Smash Burger Dinners. Plus our legendary scones and pastry along with our house-roasted coffee, beer, wine, mimosas and more.  Follow @waystationbrew on IG and keep up to date.  Way Station Brew is at the very intersection that sat the Dwight Way Station for the Shattuck Railroad Line in the 1890's.

name: Larb Thai Food & Tapas
address: 10166 San Pablo Ave El Cerrito, CA 94530
specialties: Specialties: LARB is an originating dish from the Northeast (Isaan) region of Thailand.  LARB is most often made with chicken, beef, pork, duck, fish or mushroom; flavored with fish sauce, lime juice, roasted ground rice and fresh herbs. The meat can be either raw or cooked; it is minced and mixed with chili, mint leaves, cilantro and onion. Traditionally, it is eaten with sticky rice and other Isaan favorite such as Papaya Salad, Isaan Sausage,Roasted Chicken, Bamboo Shoot Salad, Crispy Rice Ball, Grilled Chicken Liver and else. Established in 2016.

name: IB's Berkeley
specialties: Specialties: The best cheesesteaks, burgers, fries, sandwiches in Berkeley. A Bay Area staple for over 30 years!  Established in 1991.  Family owned Cheesesteak and Sandwich shop. We believe in serving premium quality meat at affordable prices. Our meat is grass-fed, pasture fed, and top quality!! We eliminated the greasy, messy cheesesteak and give you this delicious, top quality product on a delicious soft roll with cheese melted on top.

name: KoKoLo Donburi -  Berkeley
specialties: Specialties: KokoLo ~ Spirit of KoKoLo: KoKoLo Philosophy: KoKoLo means the heart and mind in Japanese, but it has a much deeper meaning in the culinary world. Our dishes are inspired by our name. We are delighted to serve each of our guests with a warm enthusiastic personal touch from the heart. Donburi is a traditional Japanese rice meal in a bowl. Its origins can be traced back to the Edo period (1600s to 1800s). At KoKoLo, our nutritious rice bowls are influenced by variations of donburis originated from different regions of Japan. Each of our rice bowl is precisely fried or simmered in our signature sauce, and carefully prepared with traditional homemade ingredients. We would love to share the tradition of heartwarming donburis to our community. Established in 2015.  KoKoLo Donburi is owned and operated by Dub Foodies Team who also operates few other restaurants. Dub Foodies team is passionate about the food they offer to the customers.

name: Starbucks
specialties: Specialties: We're not just passionate purveyors of coffee, but everything else that goes with a full and rewarding coffeehouse experience. We also offer a selection of premium teas, fine pastries and other delectable treats to please the taste buds. And the music you hear in store is chosen for its artistry and appeal. It's not unusual to see people coming to Starbucks to chat, meet up or even work. We're a neighborhood gathering place, a part of the daily routine - and we couldn't be happier about it. Get to know us and you'll see: we are so much more than what we brew. We make sure everything we do is through the lens of humanity - from our commitment to the highest quality coffee in the world, to the way we engage with our customers and communities to do business responsibly.

name: Almare Gelato Italiano
specialties: Specialties: almare specializes in high quality, artisan gelato. we make our gelato fresh everyday in the shop's laboratorio. we follow a traditional process of gelato making that allows our ingredients time to blend together, enhancing the flavor of each scoop. we don't cut corners with artificial powders or chemicals that better the appearance of the gelato but compromise the flavor. we purchase farm fresh citrus, strawberries and other fruit from monterey market in berkeley. we import our nuts from farmers in sicily and piedmont. We are proud to be part of berkeley's established tradition of authentic, fine food. Established in 2008.  Almare Gelato was founded by Alberto Malvestio in 2008.Alberto moved from the city of Treviso and brought with him the Italian Gelato tradition of his great uncle Dino, a true gelato legend.Dino taught Alberto how to carefully prepare traditional delicious gelato. He also explained how cutting corners is just not an option when preparing fresh food. Flavors such as the famous Toasted Almond and Caramelized Figs and the Lavender and Fresh Blueberries quickly became Almare's signature.In 2012 Simone Arpaio moved from his hometown of Turin and partnered up with Alberto. With more ideas and a renewed energy Almare entered into the wholesale business and since then have been proudly providing high quality gelato to some of the best restaurants of the Bay Area. In 2016 we opened our second location in Downtown Pleasanton where we can craft our gelato every morning like we do in Berkeley.Come visit us for a taste of real traditional Italian gelato!Ciao

name: Poke Parlor
specialties: Specialties: Poke Parlor is here to bring a delicious twist to the poke eating experience. Fresh and sustainably sourced foods are everything to us. From wild Scottish Salmon to locally grown fruits and vegetables, we pride ourselves in knowing that we only offer the highest quality ingredients on our menu. All our sauces are made in-house, with deep inspirations from a wide variety of Asian and Latin influences that we know people won't get enough of. If you share our obsession with seafood and bold new flavors, then we can't wait to serve you. Established in 2017.  Locally grown buddies with a passion to bring locally and sustainably sourced, high quality seafood to the Bay Area. Everything from our bowls to our forks are all biodegradable. Our goal is to leave a lasting impression on our customers, but not on our planet.

name: The Campanile
specialties: Specialties: Sather Tower, also known as the Campanile, is one of UC Berkeley's most beloved and well-known symbols. Visible for miles, the Campanile is the third-tallest bell and clock-tower in the world, and an integral part of the campus experience. Get a spectacular, sprawling view of the Bay Area from the observation platform. Tickets available at the door via credit card or Apple Pay (no cash or checks are accepted). Established in 1868.  The Campanile has been open for many years for visitors to enjoy the view from the observation deck.

name: Tomate Cafe
specialties: Specialties: All-day Breakfast and Lunch, 8am-3pm Daily in Berkeley Established in 1998.  Tomate Cafe originally started in the late 90's with a french family on the corner of Bancroft and 5th street in Berkeley! They owned this establishment for about 3 years. It since been past to 2 other owners before I arrived.

name: Sweet Treat Stop
specialties: Specialties: Sweet Treat Stop is owned and operated by Pastry Chefs from Le Cordon Bleu's Baking & Patisserie Program. We are currently the first and only mobile bakery truck in the Bay Area, baking "Fresh-On-The-Spot" Artisan Gourmet cupcakes and other sweet treats.  We cater weddings, birthdays, fund-raisers, corporate and private events. Our big pink and white plaid truck is a crowd-pleaser! The Sweet Treat Stop mobile bakery truck also features a state-of-the-art video/sound & intercom system which further adds to the overall experience of enjoying our delicious treats.

name: Udupi Palace
specialties: Specialties: Udupi Palace - serving the Bay area population with its authentic South Indian dishes.We are known for our variety of Dosa and Uthappams. We are popularly known as "a place for Dosa.......". To satisfy our customers with wide choice of South Indian Dishes, variety chutneys (dipping sauce), wide choice of Indian curries and rice variety, indian bread and indian desserts. Established in 2000.  Udupi palace is located in the heart of the Silicon Valley. We started in the year of 2000.We brought the taste bud of the pure south indian vegetarian cuisine to the Bay area. Udupi cuisine is a world-renowned cuisine. It takes its name from Udupi, a place on the southwest coast of India in the state of Karnataka. Udupi cuisine includes an entire school of South Indian vegetarian cuisine. This is 'pure' vegetarian food. The ubiquitous Indian dish Masala Dosa has its origins in Udupi. Rasam, a spicy pepper water, is another essential part of the menu.Udupi's sambhar has its own unique taste. We take pride in serving the Bay Area population with the authentic south indian vegetarian dishes, from the day we started. For the convience of our customers we opened branches in other part of the bayarea and also in other states of USA.

name: UC Botanical Garden at Berkeley
specialties: Established in 1890.  Our mission is to develop and maintain a diverse living collection of plants, to support teaching and worldwide research in plant biology, further the conservation of plant diversity, and promote public understanding and appreciation of plants and the natural environment.The 34-acre UC Botanical Garden is one of the most diverse landscapes in the world, with over 10,000 types of plants including many rare and endangered species.  Organized geographically, the Garden features 9 regions of naturalistic plantings from Italy to South Africa, along with a major collection of California native plants.  The Garden was established in 1890 and its living collections are invaluable resources for international research and conservation.
